name: ambivert
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a person who has features of both an introvert (= someone who prefers to spend time alone) and an extrovert (= someone who prefers to be with other people) in their personality: Ambiverts are sometimes also called outgoing or social introverts. An ambivert typically enjoys other people, but needs time alone.
More examplesFewer examplesMost people don’t strongly identify as introverts or extroverts. These people are called ambiverts.Ambiverts naturally engage in a flexible pattern of talking and listening.In the right context, in the right mood, around the right people, ambiverts can be extroverted. Adjusting behaviour to fit the person or situation seems to come naturally to ambiverts.
